snippet: The threat of stronger economic sanctions lurks behind the deadline, but the tough talk did little to stifle world leaders’ desire to meet individually with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.
abstract: Pres Obama, with backing of other world leaders in Group of 7, sets one-month deadline for Moscow to reverse its intervention in Ukraine and help stop pro-Russian separatist uprising; for first time, Obama lays out a timeframe, saying process cannot drag out, and emphasizes Russia will face sanctions far worse than it has had to endure in past.

byline.contributor: James Kanter contributed reporting from Brussels, Alison Smale from Berlin, and Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The threat of stronger economic sanctions lurks behind the deadline, but the tough talk did little to stifle world leaders’ desire to meet individually with President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.

headline.main: With Group of 7 Backing, Obama Gives Russia One-Month Ukraine Deadline
headline.print_headline: With Group of 7 Backing, Obama Gives Russia One-Month Ukraine Deadline
